{"step_by_step_thinking": "Periapical pathology refers to diseases that occur around the apex of the tooth. This includes abscesses, granulomas, and cysts. The zones of periapical pathology were described by Fish, who outlined five zones: the zone of infection, the zone of contamination, the zone of irritation, the zone of stimulation, and the zone of coagulation.", "answer_choice": "B. Fish"}
